question: Field trip is an effective way of teaching where organisms could be observed in their natural habitat, active and responding to stimuli in the environment. In addition, what values are developed among the students during and after the trip?

choice1: Request the parents to invite Ms. Lizardo to join them.
choice2: Ask Ms. Lizardo to do other tasks in the office until she is able to adjust.
choice3: Advise Ms. Lizardo to supervise and join the parents in their activities.

question: Based on Kubler-Ross’ model, which shows the correct arrangement of acceptance of a departed loved one?

nities through the appropriate languages of teaching and learning, including

Basic education shall be delivered in languages understood by the learners as

 “The curriculum shall be culture-sensitive;..”

choice1: Implements a curriculum that will perpetuate the entire culture of the community

choice4: More time spent working with small group

question: Should the planning of continuing professional development program consider the ASEAN Qualifications Reference Framework?
choice1: No, continuing professional development is required only in the Philippines

choice3: Yes, for professional to be globally competitive.
choice4: Not necessarily, it is enough that continuing professional development programs abide by PQF standards.
answerKey: Yes, for professional to be globally competitive.

choice4: Writing the fractions 1/2, 1/4 and 1/3 on the board
answerKey: Presenting the pizza and cutting it into two and four

question: Plants, pebbles, and blocks are just some of the effective instructional materials readily found in the environment if they are utilized properly. Which of the following is INCORRECT about their classroom use?
choice1: Make sure that the realia and model are large enough to be seen by the whole class.
choice2: Familiarize yourself with the object or model before its actual utilization.
choice3: Pass a single object around the class.
choice4: Use the objects as springboard in encouraging students' active participation.
answerKey: Pass a single object around the class.

question: In her report to UNESCO, LEARNING: The Treasure Within, Jaques Delors, strongly recommended that all education reform be conducted in the  spirit and essence of sustainable development and called for the full-fledged pursuit of reorienting education to attain sustainability. Considering his/her influence on learners, which is the most fitting and significant response from a professional teacher?
choice1: Integrate concept in Education for Sustainable (ESD) in lessons.
choice3: Create a separate subject on ESD
choice4: Serve as lecture on ESD for all groups in the community.
answerKey: Integrate concept in Education for Sustainable (ESD) in lessons.

question: In formulating classroom-level objectives, which among the following general rules should be kept in mind first?
choice1: They should be based on subject and grade level objectives
choice2: They should be consistent with teaching and learning theories and procedures
choice3: They should be related to the developmental needs and tasks of learners
choice4: They should relate to the whole child and several domains of learning
answerKey: They should be related to the developmental needs and tasks of learners

question: In general, there is a relationship between effective teachers and effective schools. Teachers, to be effective, need a supportive and positive atmosphere. This includes the following EXCEPT:
choice4: Large class size to cater every student who needs to learn
answerKey: Large class size to cater every student who needs to learn

question:
For teacher to serve as facilitator of learning, according to Kendall’s and Marzano’s new taxonomy, in which order should learners go through these processes?
 
I. cognitive
II. self-system
III. Metacognitive
If you are a constructivist, what assumptions about learning and learner govern your thinking?
choice1: For learners to learn, knowledge should be transmitted directly from teachers to learners.
choice2: Learners are empty receptacles waiting to be filled.
choice3: Learners are capable of constructing meaning of what is taught to them.
choice4: Teachers are the only source of knowledge.
answerKey: Learners are capable of constructing meaning of what is taught to them.

question: What is meant by the teachers’ indirectness according to Nate Gage?
choice2: Clarifying, building, and developing students ideas
choice3: The willingness to accept student ideas and feelings, and the ability to provide a healthy emotional climate
choice4: Support and encouragement, use of humor to release tension
answerKey: The willingness to accept student ideas and feelings, and the ability to provide a healthy emotional climate

question: What curriculum be the content\topic when the teacher asked the learner to define curriculum and complete a matrix on the differences between traditional and progressive curriculum?

choice4: Schools for children of diplomats and their dependents

question: What particular school function is developed when students internalize meaning of suffrage and apply it during election times?
What is the primary fundamental question in examining a curriculum?
choice1: How can these educational experiences be effectively organized?
choice2: What educational experiences can be provided that are likely to attain these purposes?
choice3: How can we determine whether these purposes are attained or not?
choice4: What educational purposes should the school seek to attain?
answerKey: What educational purposes should the school seek to attain?

question:
What is TRUE about the Alternative Delivery Modes (ADMs)?
 
I. Address the learning needs of the marginalized pupils and those learners at risk of dropping out
II. Help learners overcome social and economic constraints in their schooling 
III. Simplify curriculum for students at risk of dropping out
The Code of Ethics for Professional Teachers provides guidelines on acceptable Teaching behavior. These are all tolerable EXCEPT ______.
choice1: Having a romantic relationship with a student
choice2: Discovering research finding that are damaging to the country
choice3: Claiming others’ work to be yours
choice4: Occasional drinking that does not lead to drunkenness
answerKey: Claiming others’ work to be yours

question: When in curriculum decongestion the first subjects that are dropped are philosophy, arts, humanities and the like, on which philosophy is the curriculum.
Teacher Tyra believes that if her students are unwilling to learn the language, they will not learn how to spell or read. With this in mind, which principle of learning should she focus on?
choice1: One learns to do what one does.
choice2: Learning by doing is good advice.
choice3: Teachers should provide opportunities for meaningful and appropriate practice.
choice4: Learning should be goal-directed and focused.
answerKey: One learns to do what one does.

question:
What is/are TRUE od learning to be?
 
I. reflects a shift from the education goal of economic productivity to a humanistic view of education.
II. emphasize the development of the complete person
III. focuses on the development of reason only
When teachers serve as role models, acclimate new teachers to a new school, and advice new teachers about instruction, curriculum, procedure, practices, and politics. Which role do they play?

Teacher have an important role to play in peace education. How can they contribute to genuine peace education?
 
I. By creating a learning environment where both teachers and students teach and learn from one another through equitable dialogue
II. By combining lessons with practical application toward socials societal and transformation
II. By analysing issues in a holistic way that accounts for the past, present, and future, and includes the personal, local ang global levels
IV. By promoting values such as compassion, equality, interdependence, diversity and, sustainability, and nonviolence

The International Commission on Education for the 21st Century advocates four pillars of learning, namely-learning to know. Learning to do, learning to be, and learning to live together. Since there are peace and cultural diversity problems in the world and everywhere, which of the four pillars should be given more emphasis in teaching?
What pedagogy should schools adopt to help learners acquire the basic skills?
choice1: Let students make a webquest regarding a particular topic.
choice2: Do community visits and let students do a project to improve the community.
choice3: Demonstrate skills needed and then let students perform the skills until mastery is achieved.
choice4: Let students perform experiments and investigatory projects.
answerKey: Demonstrate skills needed and then let students perform the skills until mastery is achieved.

question:
Structural violence is reflected in conditions like_______.
 
I. greatly gulf between the rich and the poor
II. Highly uneven distribution of wealth and resources
III. Presence for hunger and poverty

The Philippines has the National Competency-Based Teacher Standards. Should these be taken into consideration in the planning and conduct of professional teachers’ continuing professional development programs?
choice1: No, the PQF is the only one to be considered.

question: The role of the teacher changes in a learner-centered environment. Which among the following circumstances is NOT included in Paradigm shift?
choice1: is viewed as a support, collaborator and coach for students as they learn to gather and evaluate information for themselves
choice2: actively encourages individuals to use their personal knowledge and skills to create unique solutions to problems
choice3: is viewed as the primary source of information who continually directs it to the students
choice4: participates at times as one who may not know it all but desires to learn
answerKey: is viewed as the primary source of information who continually directs it to the students

question:
The mother tongue of the learner shall be the primary medium of instruction for teaching and learning in the kindergarten level EXCEPT when__________.
 
I. The pupils in the kindergarten classroom have different mother tongues or when some of them speak another mother tongue
II. The teacher does not speak the mother tongue, are not yet available.
III. Resource, in line with the use of the mother tongue, are not yet available
IV. Teachers are not yet trained how to use the MTB-MLE program
When teachers lead other teachers to agree on standards, follow the adopted curriculum, use common pacing charts, and develop shared assessments, which role do the play?

The reconstructionist philosophy influences classroom instruction today. Teachers act as social engineers and students learn within the classroom as a social laboratory. In line with this, teachers prepare the youth for leadership and life skills. However, mandatory volunteerism often results from this preparation due to the______.
choice1: increased pressure from administrative and governmental entities
choice2: emphasis on crediting and integration of civic education with existing curriculum
choice3: Perceived sense of responsibility in the family and community
choice4: desire to get more funding from civic-oriented organizations
answerKey: emphasis on crediting and integration of civic education with existing curriculum

question: The audio-visual experience is an opportunity for the teacher to guide students for more fruitful learning. It is more effective if students
choice1: Are given quizzes immediately after the presentation
choice3: Are told to remember and memorize facts.
choice4: Listen attentively and jot down notes
answerKey: Listen attentively and jot down notes

question:
When his fellow science teachers share their frustration with students’ poorly written lab reports, Joe suggests that they invite several English teachers to recommend strategies for writing instruction. With two English teachers, the science teachers   examine a number of lab reports together and identify strengths and weaknesses. The English teachers share strategies they use in their classes to improve students’ writing.
 
Which role do the English teachers play in this case?
To enable learners to respond to the demands of the present world, which should schools do?
choice1: Teach Application-based, creative, critical, and innovative thinking
answerKey: Teach Application-based, creative, critical, and innovative thinking

question: The following are attributes of peace educator EXCEPT_________.
choice1: Lifelong learner who continues to improve his/her own learning abilities
choice2: is motivated by service but expects rewards for services
choice3: a responsible global citizen and an agent of culture and peace
choice4: has the skills of communication and conflict resolution
answerKey: is motivated by service but expects rewards for services

question:
What question/s does the learner ask at the metacognitive level processing?
 
I. What has this lesson to do with me?
II. Why did I not learn this at first?
III. How should I do this to be sure of results?
IV. What is the best way to arrive at the solution?

The following are attributes of critical thinkers as stated by Robert Ennis EXCEPT:
I.	Look for options
II.	Accepts all information
III.	Open-minded
IV.	Heuristic rather than systematic

When the teacher encourages the students to analyze issues, think critically about information given them, and help develop their skills on their own, which pillar of learning does she try to develop?

Teacher Medina always makes sure that students are aware that she is aware of their behavior and alert to difficulties they may encounter. Based on this, which recommendation on improving practice and drill does she follow?
choice1: Move around the room to monitor students’ seatwork
choice2: Provide variety and challenge in practice and drill
choice4: Keep students alert and focused on the task
answerKey: Move around the room to monitor students’ seatwork

question: Students in the Senior High School (Grades 11 and 12) will select their tracks, namely; academic, tech-voc and sports and arts and design. What is the main reason behind this?
choice1: To develop social skills among students so they will be able to adapt easily to their working environment.
choice2: To develop the mastery of knowledge or concepts among students so they can earn their degrees.
choice3: To develop mastery skills among students so that they have chances of employability.
answerKey: To develop mastery skills among students so that they have chances of employability.

question: Teacher A, an expert teacher, takes a great deal of time and expertise and makes a significant contribution to the development of anew professional. Which is his role?

In a faculty meeting, Peter expresses a concern that teachers may be treating some students differently from others. Students who to him for extra assistance have shared their perspectives, and Peter wants teachers to know what students are saying. As his colleagues discuss reasons for low student achievement, Peter challenges then to explore data about the relationship between family socioeconomic status and discipline referrals in the school. When a teacher begins to point fingers at students, he encourages them to examine how they can change his instructional practices to improve student engagement and achievement. Teacher Peter plays the role of a_______.

The classroom is very lively. There different groups and each group is brainstorming on the topic, healthy lifestyle. Every member has his/her own role to do for the realization of one goal-to make and present a Power point presentation of the topic. What pillar of education is exemplified most in the given classroom setting?
Which is an offshoot of the pillar of learning to live together?
choice2: schools show concern for what happens to learners after they leave school
choice3: Students learn how to understand others and appreciate diversity among people
choice4: Students learn how to care for the environment
answerKey: Students learn how to understand others and appreciate diversity among people

question: Miss Riel is very excited to do her presentation about the effect the global warming to Grade 5 student. She want to make sure the children will be interested. While preparing her slide, she should_____.
choice1: use a different slid design with nature images for each slide to sustain interest
choice2: put animation and slide transition on its slide to sustain attention
choice3: include picture and a short video clip that capture the effect of global warming
choice4: put one paragraph per slide to emphasize the fact about global warming
answerKey: include picture and a short video clip that capture the effect of global warming

question: For the continuing professional development seminar of the graduate in the doctorate level to meet standards, the outcome/s should be accordance with which level in the Philippine Qualifications Framework?
Which pillar of education is developed most when one prepares and does PowerPoint presentation?

Why should continuing professional development be in accordance with the Philippine Qualifications Framework (PQF)?
Because the PQF………FOR EACH LEVEL OF THE Philippine education system
choice4: Describes the attributes of a graduate

question: What makes operant conditioning different from classical conditioning?
choice1: In operant conditioning, reinforcement is presented whether or not the subject responds
choice2: In operant conditioning, reinforcement is presented before the subject responds.
choice3: In operant conditioning, reinforcement is paired and presented with an unconditioned stumulus
choice4: In operant conditioning, reinforcement is presented only when the subject responds
answerKey: In operant conditioning, reinforcement is presented only when the subject responds

question: One of the nine basic teaching principles wherein effectiveness is identified in terms of raising student achievement scores is the principle of clarity which means that:
choice1: Similar expectations are maintained for activities and behavior at all times for all students.
choice2: Inappropriate behavior is attended quickly to stop it and present its spread
choice3: Lessons are presented logically and sequentially and enhanced illustrations and by keeping in touch with students
choice4: All student work, including seatwork, homework and papers is corrected, errors are discussed, and feedback is provided
answerKey: Lessons are presented logically and sequentially and enhanced illustrations and by keeping in touch with students

question:
Ned Flanders’ studies on teacher styles focused on the development of an instrument for quantifying verbal communication in the classroom. Teacher talk is categorized as a direct behavior and  an indirect behavior. Which among the following belongs to indirect behavior?
I. Giving direction
II. Accepts feeling 
III. Criticizing or justifying
IV. Ask questions
V. praises or encourages

For the continuing professional development seminar of the Bachelor of Education graduate to meet standards, the outcome/s should be in accordance with which level in the Philippine Qualifications Framework?
What question does the learner ask at the self-system level processing?
choice1: What has this lesson to do with me?
choice2: Why did I not learn this at first?
choice3: What is the best way to arrive at the solution?
choice4: How should I do this to be sure of results?
answerKey: What has this lesson to do with me?

question: Miss Sanchez engaged her learners in activities where they develop writing, critical thinking, problem solving skills, and risk taking. Which of these 21st century skills does Miss Sanchez possess?

Investigations based on Lippitt and White found that children exhibit certain behaviors as the result of the teachers teaching style. If children were taught by an authoritarian teacher, he/she will exhibit the following:
I. minimal student productivity
II. failed to initiate activity
III. aggressiveness
IV. Confusion
V. works assignments without the aid of the teacher 
VI. rebellious toward the leader

At every team or faculty meeting, Lilian identifies something new that she tries to apply in her classroom. Her willingness to explore new strategies is infectious. Other teachers, encouraged by her willingness to discuss what works and what doesn’t, begin to talk about their teaching ang how it influences student learning. As a teacher, she shows that she is a//an________.

“Every time you meet your students, put your first impressions about each of them within brackets and allow to disclose themselves as they are, is a wise thing to do”, is an advice from a/an__________.
Which of the following best defines curriculum development?
choice1: The planning of learning opportunities intended to bring about certain desired changes in pupils and the assessment of the extent to which these changes have taken place.
choice2: A continuous cycle of activities in which all elements of curriculum are considered.
choice3: The total mental phenomena directly received at any given time
choice4: Education is aiding each child to be socially creative individuals.
answerKey: The planning of learning opportunities intended to bring about certain desired changes in pupils and the assessment of the extent to which these changes have taken place.

question: Supposing despite early preparations for a smooth transition from one activity to another, an unexpected failure of operation of an instructional device like a projector or a computer happens. Could the teacher be blamed for the idle time that ensues? What should she have done?
choice1: No, she can continue the activity the following day rather than wait
choice2: Yes, she should know how to repair any failure or ask for help immediately
choice3: Yes, anticipate a failure and get ready with an alternative plan
choice4: No, she is confident the devices are in good condition, no need for a plan
answerKey: Yes, anticipate a failure and get ready with an alternative plan

question:
Objective: The students must be able to perform the experiment explaining the Boyle’s law in front of the class.

Which among the following characteristic of instructional objectives in the classroom does this VIOLATE?
choice1: Objectives should also be formulated so that clear distinctions are required among learners to attain different behaviors.
choice2: Complex objectives need to be stated analytically and specifically enough
choice3: Objectives should be realistic and should only include what can be translated into classroom experience
choice4: Objectives are developmental, representing roads to travel rather than terminal points.
answerKey: Complex objectives need to be stated analytically and specifically enough

question: Teacher Laida is an elementary grades teacher. She is very active in community activities. Every election time she serves as a member of the election committee. Then, during one election period her uncle ran for mayor. Laida got very much involved in the campaign. Is Teacher Laida’s action ethical?
choice1: Yes, because it is her role to serve the community
choice2: No, because serving during election time is very dangerous to life.
choice3: No, because she should be non-partisan.
choice4: Yes, because she should support her relative
answerKey: No, because she should be non-partisan.

question: Here is a lesson objective in literature: “Using the six description of the elements of a good short story identify in writing the six elements in the short story by O. Henry with complete accuracy.” Applying Robert Mager’s principle on writing performance objectives, which is the criterion measure?
choice1: “ using the six description of the element for a short story”
choice2: “ the six element in the short story by O. Henry with complete accuracy

question: Parents usually complain that the school where their children go, changes their textbooks. If you are the teacher, how would you explain to the parents, the practice they are complaining about?
choice1: Textbooks cover are dirty and faded and do not look presentable
choice2: Textbooks are already old and with pages torn or destroyed
choice3: There are new authors of textbooks who are popular
choice4: There are new developments in curriculum content included in new books.
answerKey: There are new developments in curriculum content included in new books.

question: Mr. Sanchez, in planning his lessons, wants to base much of his instructional approach on Lev Vygotsky’s theory of “zone of proximal development.” In accordance with this theory, which of the following strategies would best support learning for Macy, a 13-year-old girl?
choice1: Having her work with another student whose skill and concept levels are slightly more advanced that hers
choice2: Giving her many opportunities for practice, thereby reinforcing the skills and concept that she has already has already mastered
choice3: Having her use of manipulatives and technology that are readily available
choice4: Having her work alone in a quiet atmosphere where she can access reference material appropriate to her grade level
answerKey: Having her work with another student whose skill and concept levels are slightly more advanced that hers

question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a defense mechanism?
choice1: “I realized that I was angry with my brother, so I sat down to talk about the issue.”
choice2: After the new baby was brought home, his four-year old brother threw temper tantrums and wrote all over the walls with crayons; acts he had not committed since age two.
choice3: When questioned by a friend, the woman who was brutally raped last month answered that she was doing fine and that the entire incident had slipped her mind.
choice4: “After my grandmother dies, my father still set her bed every night.”
answerKey: “I realized that I was angry with my brother, so I sat down to talk about the issue.”

question: The following are characteristic of progressive curriculum except.
choice1: focuses on the experience of the student and supervised by the teacher
choice2: the classroom is only one place for the student to learn; learning can take place anywhere
choice3: takes into account all the curricular element and test these element through real life application
choice4: knowledge that come from values disciplines should be focus
answerKey: knowledge that come from values disciplines should be focus

question:
Which of the following nonverbal behaviors of the students are considered as attentive behaviors? 

I.  Alert, energetic, positive facial expressions 
II. Turning around to listen to a student who is speaking 
III. Maintaining eye contact with the teacher
IV.  Tipping the chair back and forth
For the continuing professional development seminar of the graduate in the masters to meet standards, the outcome/s should be accordance with which level in the Philippine Qualifications Framework?
Why waste so much time copying notes from the board when everything is in the textbook?” is a remark that comes from a_______.
Which of the following quotations is NOT a product of John Dewey’s thought on social educational reform?
choice1: Give the pupils something to do not something to learn and the doing is of such a nature as to demand thinking naturally results
choice2: Every teacher needs to improve not because they are not good enough, but because they can be even better.
choice3: Education, therefore, is a process of living and not a preparation for future living
choice4: If we teach today’s student as we taught yesterday’s we rob them of tomorrow.
answerKey: Every teacher needs to improve not because they are not good enough, but because they can be even better.

question: Which of the following is a reason for the continuous appraisal of the existing curriculum in all levels?
choice4: Changing needs and condition of society
answerKey: Changing needs and condition of society

question:
For teacher to serve as facilitator of learning, according to Kendall’s and Marzano’s new taxonomy, in which order should learners go through these processes?
 
I. cognitive
II. self-system
III. Metacognitive
Which of the following school activities is closely related and has greater impact to curriculum development?
choice1: Monthly meeting with the barangay officials
choice2: Review of the textbooks and reference material
choice3: School visit of visitors from other places
answerKey: Review of the textbooks and reference material

question: Which is a proof of the public-private partnership for government to give access to quality secondary education?

Which is/are teacher’s responsibility/ies?
I. To ensure that assessment always supports learning and is based on a wide range of evidence.
II. Plan, design and carry out assessment and help them to understand what is expected.
III. Involve learners fully in assessment and help them to understand what is expected.
Which is/are NOT implied in the aforementioned provisions of RA 10533?
choice3: That schools be independent of the community
answerKey: That schools be independent of the community

question: Which is the correct statement for Education for Sustainable Development (ESD)?
choice1: It concerns only the developing countries.
choice2: It concerns economic and social development and environment protection.
choice3: It is economic development at the expense of the environment
choice4: It is social development through exclusive education
answerKey: It concerns economic and social development and environment protection.

question:
Which is/are way/s by which schools can be learned-centered, according to the aforementioned provisions of RA 10533?
 
I. Using Mother Tongue as language of instruction
II. By making curriculum flexible and responsive to community needs
III. By indigenizing curriculum
Which is the main objective of the Educational Service Contacting Scheme, or ESC?
choice1: To decongest public secondary schools by “contracting” the excess capacities of private high schools through the provision of subsidies for students who, otherwise, would have gone to the public high schools
choice2: To fill up the private schools with students or else go bankrupt and close
choice3: To enter into an agreement with parents to send their children to school or else they get penalized
choice4: To enter into a contract with public school students to stay and complete schooling or else their own tuition fees
answerKey: To decongest public secondary schools by “contracting” the excess capacities of private high schools through the provision of subsidies for students who, otherwise, would have gone to the public high schools

question:
The mother tongue of the learner shall be the primary medium of instruction for teaching and learning in the kindergarten level EXCEPT when__________.
 
I. The pupils in the kindergarten classroom have different mother tongues or when some of them speak another mother tongue
II. The teacher does not speak the mother tongue, are not yet available.
III. Resource, in line with the use of the mother tongue, are not yet available
IV. Teachers are not yet trained how to use the MTB-MLE program
Which of the following is mostly likely to be a characteristics of the teacher who is a good implementer of the curriculum?
choice1: Teachers controls classroom activities and interaction
choice2: Teacher emphasizes pupil discussion on varied topics
choice3: Teacher provides differentiated activities for the students
choice4: Teacher sticks to standards set by the subject content
answerKey: Teacher provides differentiated activities for the students

question: Which is not perennialist point of view about education?
choice1: Experience is the real test of the worth of all things
choice2: Truth is unusual and unchanging and therefore good education is constant
choice3: Education should stimulate human to think critically
choice4: Education should cultivate human’s rational mind
answerKey: Experience is the real test of the worth of all things

question: Which is progressive approach in transforming education that holistically critiques current shortcoming, failures, and discriminatory practices in education?

Which among the following shows the correct order of objectives in ascending order?
I.	Course objectives
II.	Unit plan objectives
III.	Classroom objectives
IV.	Lesson plan objectives
V.	Program objectives
DepEd A Child-and Community-Centered Education  System (ACCES) describes the learner-centred education that teachers ought to provide. Which one does NOT describe learner-centered education?

Which modes of delivery apply to the e-IMPACT system?
 
I. Programmed teaching
II. Peer-group learning
III. Individual study
Which among the following greatly distinguishes objectives from goals?
choice1: These cut across subjects and grade levels
choice3: These state what students should accomplish over the entire school year
choice4: These are stated in behavioral terms.
answerKey: These are stated in behavioral terms.

question: Which is TRUE of Open High School Program?
choice1: Falls under the alternative learning system
choice2: Recommended for “Students At Risk of Dropping Out” who permanently cannot attend regular classes
choice4: Open to all students who are interest
answerKey: Recommended for “Students At Risk of Dropping Out” who permanently cannot attend regular classes

question:
In a knowledge-based economy, schools can act as agents of changes by___________.
I. engaging itself in transmissive education
II. equipping learners with lifetime skills such as knowledge retrieval, comprehension, application and utilization
III. giving the learners the latest updates in education
Which of these goals DOES NOT achieve global education?
choice1: Promote life skills for young adults

question: Which does Education Service Contracting Scheme point to?
choice1: The independence of the private school system from the public school system
choice2: The complementary roles of public and private institutions in the educational system
choice3: The sufficiency of the public school system
choice4: The sufficiency of the private school system
answerKey: The complementary roles of public and private institutions in the educational system

question: Which is NOT true about globalization?
choice1: As advanced by the ASEAN Heads of states it has three distinct pillars: economic socio-cultural, and political community
choice2: It is one of the most dominant forces facing education in the 21st Century.
choice3: It affects all countries, some more favourably than the others in terms of economic growth, national sovereignty, and cultural identity.
choice4: It seeks to explain the integration of economies and societies around the world as they are knit together by travel, language, values and ideas, trade, labor and financial flows, communication and technology.
answerKey: As advanced by the ASEAN Heads of states it has three distinct pillars: economic socio-cultural, and political community

question: Which of the following skills should be required of children and youth to master the greatest challenges regardless of national origin or cultural upbringing?
Based on RA 10533, the Enhanced Basic Education Act of 2013, is a non-licensed teacher allowed to teach in the K to 12 Curriculum full time?
choice1: Yes, only in TechVoc track where there is dearth of qualified teachers.
choice2: That depends on the policy of the educational institution.
choice3: No, no one may each without a license.
choice4: Yes, provided he/she obtains a license within five years from the time of hiring.
answerKey: Yes, provided he/she obtains a license within five years from the time of hiring.

question:
“Make education learner-oriented and responsive to the needs, cognitive and 
Cultural capacity, the circumstances and diversity of learners, schools and commu-
nities through the appropriate languages of teaching and learning, including
mother tongue as a learning resource.”

Basic education shall be delivered in languages understood by by the learners as
The language plays a strategic role in shaping the formative years of learners…..
 “The curriculum shall be culture-sensitive;..”
“The curriculum shall be flexible enough to enable and allow schools to localize,
Indigenize and enhance the same base on their respective educational and social
Contexts. The production and development of locally produced teaching materials
shall be encouraged and approval of these materials shall devolve to the regional
and division education units.”

36. Schools should be culture-sensitive. Which is an indicator of culture sensitivity?
choice1: Knowing that differences exist between cultures
choice2: labelling cultural practice as right and wrong
choice3: Labelling cultural practice right or wrong in the light of the organizational goals
choice4: Identifying which is better or worse cultural practice
answerKey: Knowing that differences exist between cultures

question:
Which are classified as bullying?
 
I. Punching, shoving, kicking, slapping tickling, headlocks, inflicting school pranks, teasing, and fighting using available objects as weapons
II. Any act that causes damage to a victim’s psyche and/or emotional well being
III. Name-calling, tormenting, and commenting negatively on victim’s looks, clothes and body
IV. Cyber-bullying or any bullying done through the use of technology or any electronic means
Which among the following is closest to the real human digestive system for study in the classroom?
choice1: Drawing of the human digestive system on the board
choice2: Model of the human digestive system
choice3: The human digestive system projected on an OHP
choice4: Drawing of the human digestive system on a page of a textbook
answerKey: Model of the human digestive system

question: Which of the following is the role of educational technology in learning according to the traditionalist point of view?
choice1: It engages learners in active, constructive, intentional, authentic, and cooperative learning.
choice2: It serves as a presenter of knowledge, just like teachers.
choice3: It serves as tools to support knowledge construction.
choice4: It is a social medium to support learning by conversing.
answerKey: It serves as a presenter of knowledge, just like teachers.

question: Which is the best reason why teachers state the objectives before using instructional media?
choice2: To determine which media to use best.
choice4: To be able to practice how to operate the equipment
answerKey: To determine which media to use best.

question: Which of the following is a limitation of models and real objects in teaching and learning?
choice3: They are readily available in the environment, around school and in the home.

question: Which statement about the subject-centered curriculum is not true?
choice1: The teacher has full control of the classroom activities
choice2: There is a high level of cooperative interaction
choice3: The main task is mastery of learning
choice4: It covers much content in a short period of time
answerKey: There is a high level of cooperative interaction

question: Which role do teachers play when they help their colleagues by sharing instructional resources such as Web sites, reading?

Which role do teacher-leaders play?
 
I. shape culture of their schools
II. Improve student learning
III. Influence practice among their peers
Would it be easier to understand and retain the concept of fractions if Mrs. Domingo began the lesson on fractions with the meaning of 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, etc.
choice1: Yes, provided we include a concrete application of the abstract
choice2: It depends on the teaching skills of the teacher
choice3: Yes, provided we proceed to the concrete
choice4: No, for better learning we proceed from the concrete to the abstract
answerKey: No, for better learning we proceed from the concrete to the abstract

question: After teaching  them the process of experimenting, Teacher Joe wanted his students to be able set up an experiment to find an answer to a scientific problem. Which will he ask his students to do?
choice1: Research on the answers to this scientific problem: Can aerial plans survive when transferred in soil?
choice2: Observe if aerial plants can survive when planted  in soil. Note your observations and present them in class
choice3: Can aerial plants also live on land? Research on experiments already conducted. Present your finding in class.
choice4: Set up and experiment to find out if aerial plants can also live on land.
answerKey: Set up and experiment to find out if aerial plants can also live on land.

question: After 2002, is there another way of obtaining a professional teacher’s license other than passing the LET?
choice1: Yes, by applying for the conversion of one’s Professional Board Examination for Teachers (PBET) passing rating to a license.
choice2: Yes, if one has three years of teaching with very satisfactory teaching performance
choice3: Yes, if one has five years of teaching with very satisfactory teaching performance.
answerKey: Yes, by applying for the conversion of one’s Professional Board Examination for Teachers (PBET) passing rating to a license.

question: Which situation best illustrates the concept of growth?
choice1: An education student has gained knowledge on approaches and strategies in teaching different subjects.
choice2: A kinder pupil gains 2 pounds within two months.
choice3: Elementary grader has learned to play piano.
choice4: A high school students gets a score of 85 in a mental ability test.
answerKey: A kinder pupil gains 2 pounds within two months.

question: Which is NOT true about globalization?
choice1: It is one of the most dominant forces facing education in the 21st Century.
choice2: It seeks to explain the integration of economies and societies around the world as they are knit together by travel, language, values and ideas, trade, labor and financial flows, communication and technology
choice3: It affects all countries, some more favourably than the others in terms of economic growth, national sovereignty, and cultural identity.
choice4: As advanced by the ASEAN Heads of states it has three distinct pillars: economic socio-cultural, and political community
answerKey: As advanced by the ASEAN Heads of states it has three distinct pillars: economic socio-cultural, and political community

question: Which statements below best describes development?
choice1: A high school student’s height increased by 5’2” to 5’4”
choice2: A student had learned to operate the computer.
choice4: A high school student’s change in weight from 110 lbs. to 125 lbs.
answerKey: A student had learned to operate the computer.

question:
With which kind/s of interaction is the goal of global or international education where Filipino teachers play a part?
 
I. Thinking, perceiving, communicating, and behaving in new and different ways with people from many different backgrounds
II. Expecting people to think, perceive, communicate and behave in the same way that Filipino do
III. Making people adopt Filipino beliefs and practices as these are highly positive
Ana isa licensed teacher but has quit teaching for the past years. After ﬁve years, she decided to serve as a teacher again. Can Ana go back to teaching immediately?
choice1: No, she has abandoned the teaching profession
choice2: Yes, she is a licensed teacher.
choice3: Yes, especially if there is no other teacher who can ﬁll in the vacant position.
choice4: No, she gas to take ﬁrst a 12-unit refresher course before she can go back to teaching.
answerKey: No, she gas to take ﬁrst a 12-unit refresher course before she can go back to teaching.

question: Which part of the lesson is the symbolic stage?
choice1: Writing the fractions 1/2, 1/4, 1/3, 2/4 on the board
choice3: Dividing the pizza further into four
answerKey: Writing the fractions 1/2, 1/4, 1/3, 2/4 on the board

question: Which statement is NOT true of CHED?
choice1: It regulates and supervises tertiary education
choice2: It is governed by commissioners headed by a Chairperson
choice3: It is in charge of education programs in all levels
choice4: It supervises both public and private higher education institutions
answerKey: It is in charge of education programs in all levels

question: While there is modernity and progress through the use of technology in instruction, what is the greatest danger along the domain of learning that is posed by technology?
choice3: Using technology to lighten up lessons
choice4: Using technology to fill in lesson gaps

question: You wanted your students to learn the different bodies of water as a part of your lesson. Which of these objectives is not appropriate for your lesson?
choice1: Draw the different kinds of bodies of water
choice2: Go on a field trip to study all kinds of bodies of water
choice3: Name the different kinds of bodies of water
choice4: Name ways by which we can protect the bodies of water
answerKey: Go on a field trip to study all kinds of bodies of water

question:
Which statement/s on “Learning to do” is/are CORRECT?
 
I. Learning to do calls for new types of skills, more behavioural than intellectual
II. The material and the technology are becoming secondary to human qualities and interpersonal relationship.
III. Learning to do implies shift from skill to competence.
